stand_out:
- The project identifies additional data streams that might help with the next stages of the rollout.
- The project provides a working link to the Public Tableau data and visualizations.

rubric_items.passed_description:
The project answers the questions on the product and market from a fundamental, atomic, objective standpoint.

The project forms hypotheses that not only address user issues, but market-centric issues, including how a flying taxi service would affect the driver experience & traffic conditions.
rubric_items.criteria: The project outputs the existing use cases of taxis, their users, their shortcomings with the existing product, and hypotheses around how a flying taxi car service will solve these problems.

rubric_items.passed_description: The project identifies the number of records, what each record represents, the primary key of the dataset, and the temporal & spatial ranges of the dataset.
rubric_items.criteria: The project outputs an understanding of the high-level granularity and scope of a dataset.

rubric_items.passed_description: The project identifies the average, median, and 1st/2nd standard deviations of key dimensions within the dataset.
rubric_items.criteria: The project outputs an understanding of the distribution and scope of the critical dimensions in the dataset.

rubric_items.passed_description: The project identifies the spatial trends in historical taxi ride dataset to identify viable locations for the flying taxi service pick-up & drop-off nodes, through plotting coordinates on a geospatial map, visualizing density, and overlaying with third-party data sources.
rubric_items.criteria: The project outputs an understanding of spatial analyses in the dataset.

rubric_items.passed_description: The project identifies temporal trends in the dataset through time-series visualizations, in order to to understand when the optimal hours and/or days of week to deploy the flying taxi car service.
rubric_items.criteria: The project outputs an understanding of temporal analyses in the dataset.

rubric_items.passed_description: The project identifies insights around qualitative responses around the existing use cases for ride-share ground transportation, if people would be willing to use a flying taxi car service, how much they are willing to pay for it, various personas of potential adopters, and general sentiment around the concern/excitement of such a service.
rubric_items.criteria: The project analyzes user research data to further support or reject the product proposal.
